channel.title: Dietrich Ayala
channel.description: Internet freedom, the web and Mozilla.

item.title: Nicholas Lehuen on Project Scope and Design
item.description:
"My point would be the same with any other language, and

it's not rocket science : keep projects within precise functional

boundaries, and use carefully designed API whenever you have to cross those

boundaries. Don't think about building a project that spans those

boundaries, let people who know how to handle the stuff from abroad handle

it. If you're interested into changing your scope, then start a new project."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Dan Gillmor Draws a Line in the Sand
item.description:
"Here's my message to the record industry and its allies:

I'm not a thief. I'm a customer. When you treat me like a thief, I won't be your customer.

Enough is enough."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Associative Databases on Wiremine
item.description: "The associative model doesn't use tables. It stores all the "things" (name, fax number, birthday, etc.) completely separate from the "relationships" (known as "associations", which is where the name comes from) between those things. For example: Person has a name, Person has a birthday, Person has a photography, and so on. If you want to add a new piece of information to an existing thing, you create the thing and then associate it with the old one without modifying the structure of the database."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Legos and the Semantic Web (via XMLHack)
item.description: Good overview explanation of the concepts behind the semantic web.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Question: What did the instructor at the school for Kamikaze pilots say to his students?
item.description:
Answer:

"Watch closely. I'm only going to do this once."

(Author unknown)Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Money Origami (via Boing Boing)
item.description: "Folding paper money (or "money origami") is my one true creative output. My best original designs include spiders, eyeglasses, sailboats, and framed portraits. I got started in high school when I learned how to make a ring out of a dollar bill. I generally make these items to leave as tips."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Building Taxonomies (MS Press, via IA)
item.description: "Building taxonomies. Chapter 6 of Susan Conway's and Char Sligar's book Unlocking Knowledge Assets is available on Microsoft Press' site. The chapter entitled "Building Taxonomies" defines what taxonomies are, how they play a role in content management and how to build and maintain them."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Andrei Zmievski, PHP Developer
item.description: "Programming is an art form that fights back."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: David McCusker, on writing.
item.description: "(I'm much happier being able to write for a public mode.) I don't think my opinion is worth enough for private ideas. But sharing can make marginal notions almost worthwhile."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala
